STATIC_heading.text: ABBREVIATIONS

STATIC_table.text:
AngioangiographyMDCTmultidetector CT scanner
APanteroposteriorMR, MRImagnetic resonance, magnetic resonance imaging
BabariumMRAmagnetic resonance angiography
BEbarium enemaMRVmagnetic resonance venography
C-spinecervical spineMUGAmultiple-gated acquisition (scan)— radioactive of heart function
CTcomputed tomographyPAposteroanterior
CXRchest x-rayPACSpicture archival and communications system—medical imaging technology providing storage and access for images from multiple modalities.
Decubdecubitus—lying downPETpositron emission tomography
DICOMdigital image communication inmedicine—standard protocol for storage and transmission of images between imaging devicesPET-CTpositron emission tomography– computed tomography—performed using a single machine
DIdiagnostic imagingPET-MRIpositron emission tomographymagnetic resonants imaging
DSAdigital subtraction angiographyRAIUradioactive iodine uptake (test)—tests thyroid gland function
EBUSendobronchial ultrasoundRFAradiofrequency ablation
EBUS-TBNAendobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspirationSBFTsmall bowel follow-through
ECHOechocardiographySPECTsingle photon emission computed tomography—radioactive substances and a computer are used to create 3D images
EUSendoscopic ultrasonographyTc-99mradioactive technetium—common medical isotope used in heart, brain, thyroid, liver, bone, and lung scans
18F-FDGfluorodeoxyglucose— radiopharmaceutical used in PET scanning; 18F-FDGTl-201thallium-201—radioisotope used in scanning heart muscle
fMRIfunctional MRIT-spinethoracic spine
Gdgadolinium—MRI contrast agentUGIupper gastrointestinal (series)
I-123isotope of radioactive iodine—used in thyroid scansUS, U/Sultrasound; ultrasonography
I-131isotope of radioactive iodine—used in diagnosis (thyroid scan) and treatment for thyroid cancerV/Q scanventilation-perfusion scan of the lungs (Q stands for rate of blood flow or blood volume)
IVPintravenous pyelogram  
KUBkidneys-ureters-bladder—x-ray imaging without contrast  
LATlateral  
LS filmslumbosacral (spine) films  
L-spinelumbar spine
